page.title: 20Worsley Mesnes Changing
page.content: Our area, once a ribbon development with allotments small holdings and farms, is now densely populated with flats, maisonettes and houses. Even Hawkley Hall, a Jacobean building, where Oliver Cromwell was reputed to have slept, was reduced to rubble to make way for private housing. The canal once a busy waterway for working barges is now used for leisure. The cotton mills are being redeveloped and coal mines have closed taking many jobs with them. The cooling towers and electtric- ity works are soon to come down. Also the tower blocks, too costly to repair, may be demolished. Reorganisation of Secondary Education will give this area its own High School. Our old primary school building has become a Moslem Mosque. The busy railway branch line has been lifted, the embankment lowered and a ring road is planned in its stead
